intro: Geniostoma mooreanum, commonly known as the Moorean starling plant, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, featuring small, lanceolate leaves arranged in opposite pairs. Its flowers are usually white or pale blue, with five petals and prominent stamens. Geniostoma mooreanum is often found in moist, shaded environments within its native habitat.
